translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions

original: 18.21. Saññojanagocchakādi, Hetuduka🔽Saññojanaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nosaññojano nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cattāri …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate cattāri.
analyzed: saññojana gocchaka ādi hetu duka  saññojanam hetum dhammam paṭicca nosaññojanaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cattāri pe vipāke ekam pe avigate cattāri
translated: The Numerical Series of the Conditions🔽With a condition that is a fetter there is an effect that is not a fetter. With a condition that is a fetter there is an effect that is a fetter. With a condition that is not a fetter there is an effect that is not a fetter. With a condition that is a fetter there is an effect that is a fetter and an effect that is not a fetter. With a condition that is not a fetter there is an effect that is a fetter and an effect that is not a fetter. With a condition that is a fetter there is an effect that is a fetter and an effect that is not a fetter.

original: Ganthaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nogantho nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava.🔽Oghaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noogho nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: gantham hetum dhammam paṭicca noganthaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā nava pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava  ogham hetum dhammam paṭicca no oghaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a condition that is a shackle there is an effect that is not a shackle. With a condition that is a shackle there is an effect that is a shackle. With a condition that is not a shackle there is an effect that is not a shackle. With a condition that is a shackle there is an effect that is a shackle and an effect that is not a shackle. With a condition that is not a shackle there is an effect that is a shackle and an effect that is not a shackle. With a condition that is a shackle there is an effect that is a shackle and an effect that is not a shackle.🔽With a condition that is a flood there is an effect that is not a flood. With a condition that is a flood there is an effect that is a flood. With a condition that is not a flood there is an effect that is not a flood. With a condition that is a flood there is an effect that is a flood and an effect that is not a flood. With a condition that is not a flood there is an effect that is a flood and an effect that is not a flood. With a condition that is a flood there is an effect that is a flood and an effect that is not a flood.

original: Yogaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noyogo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pañca …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: yogam hetum dhammam paṭicca no yogaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: With a condition that is a yoke there is an effect that is not a yoke. With a condition that is a yoke there is an effect that is a yoke. With a condition that is not a yoke there is an effect that is not a yoke. With a condition that is a yoke there is an effect that is a yoke and an effect that is not a yoke. With a condition that is not a yoke there is an effect that

original: Nīvaraṇaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nonīvaraṇo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cattāri … vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate cattāri.
analyzed: nīvaraṇam hetum dhammam paṭicca no nīvaraṇaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cattāri vipāke ekam pe avigate cattāri
translated: Dependent on a hindernce as condition, a non-hindernce that is not a root-cause arises. (In brief:) In the section on root-cause, there are four (instances). In the section on result, there is one (instance). … In the section on indeterminate, there are four (instances).

original: Noparāmāsaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanoparāmāso nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi … vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na uparāmāsam hetum dhammam paṭicca na na uparāmāsaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: Dependent on a wrong resort as condition, a non-wrong resort that is not a root-cause arises. (In brief:) In the section on root-cause, there are three (instances). In the section on result, there is one (instance). … In the section on indeterminate, there are three (instances).
